gurmukhi: rwj ky swj ko kaun gumwn indwn ju Awpn sMg n jY hY ]Baun BMfwr Bry Gr su eyk hI bwr ibgwn khY hY ]
transliteration: Raaj Ke Saaj Ko Kaoun Goumaan Nidaan Ju Aapan San Na Jai Hai|| Bhaoun Bhandaar Bhare Ghar Baar Su Ek Hibaat Bigadn Kahai Hai||
translation: What to talk of this royal paraphernalia, it will also not accompany at the end; all the places and treasures will become another’s property in an instant;

gurmukhi: puqR klqR su im`qR sKw koeI AMiq smY quih swQ n dY hY ]cyq ry cyq Acyq mhwN psu sMg QIXo so BI sMg n jYhY ]161]
transliteration: Poutra Klatra Su Mittra Sakhaa Koiant(i) Samai Tuh(i) Saath Na Dai Hai|| Chet Achet Mahaan Pas(u) San Theeyo So Bhisan Na Jai Hai||161||
translation: “The sons, wife and friends etc, none of them will accompany you at the end; O great animal, living in unconscious state ! forsake your sleep even now, because your body, which has been born with you, it will also not accompany you.161.

gurmukhi: kaun Bros Btwn ko BUpq Bwr pry ijn Bwg shYgy ]Bwj hY BIr BXwnk huAY kr BwrQ my nhI Byr chYgy ]
transliteration: Kaoun Bdaros Bhataan Ko Bhoopat Bhaar Dare Jin Bhaag Sahaige|| Bhaaj Hai Bheer Bhayaanak Huai Kar Bhaarah Me Nahibher Chahaige||
translation: “You cannot trust these warriors, because all of them will not endure the burden of your actions; they will all run away in front of al the dreadful afflictions;

gurmukhi: eyk aupcwr n cwl hY rwjn imqR sBY miRq nIr bhYgy ]puqR klqR sBY qumry niRp CUtq pRwn mswn khYgy ]162]
transliteration: Ek Oupchaar Na Dhaal Hai Raajan Mitra Sabhai Mrit Neer Bahaige|| Poutra Klatr Sabhai Toumre Nrip Chhodhtat Praan Masaan Kahaige||162||
translation: “None of the measures will be useful to you and all these friends of yours will flow away like the flowing water; your sons, your wife, all of them will call you a ghodt.”162.
Speech of Parasnath addressed to Matsyendra :

gurmukhi: mun kaun hY vih rwau ]iqh Awj moih bqwau ]iqh jIq ho jb jwid ]qb BwKIAau muih rwie ]163]
transliteration: Mounndkaoun Hai Vah(i) Raao|| Tih Aaj Mohe Bataao|| Tih Jeet Ho Jab Jaae|| Tab Bhaakheeau Muhe Raae||163||
translation: “O sage ! tell me, who is that king, whom I should conquer? And then you will call me the greatest Sovereign on all.”163.
Speech of Matsyendra addressed to Parasnath :

gurmukhi: sun rwj rwjn hMs ]Bv BUm ky AivqMs ]quih jIq ey sB rwie ]pr so n jIqXo jwie ]164]
transliteration: Soun Raaj Raajan Hans|| Bhav Bhoom Ke Avitans|| Tuh(i) Jeet E Sabh Raae|| Par So Na Jeetyo Jaae||164||
translation: “O Sovereign ! you are the greatest on the earth; you have conquered all the kings, but whatever I am telling you, you have not conquered it.”164.

gurmukhi: Aibbyk hY iqh nwau ]qv hIX mY iqh Twau ]iqh jIq khI n BUp ]vh hY srUp AnUp ]165]
transliteration: Abibek Hai Tih Naao|| Tab Heeya Mai Tih Thaao|| Tih Jeet Kahina Bhoop|| Vah Hai Saroop Anoop||165||
translation: “its name is Avivek (ignorance) and it abides in your heart; regarding its victory, O king ! you have not said anything, that also has a unique form.”165.

transliteration: Bal(i) Maheep Jin Chhalyo Brahm Baavan Bas Kinno|| Krishan Bishan Jeen Dare Dand Raghoupat Te Linno||

gurmukhi: bil mhIp ijn ClXo bHm bwvn bs ikMno ]kiRSn ibSn ijn hry dMf rGupq qy ilMno ]
transliteration: Das Greevah(i) Jin Haraa Soubhat Sounbhaasur Khandyo|| Mahkhaasur Mardeeaa Maan Madhkeet Bihandyo||
translation: This Avivek had conquered mighty Bali and had to become sub-servient to Vaman; he destroyed Krishna (Vishnu) and received penalty form Raghupati Ram;

gurmukhi: ds gRIvih ijn hrw suBt suMBwsur KMfXo ]mhKwsur mrdIAw mwn mDkIt ibhMfXo ]
transliteration: Maoo Madan Raaj Raajaa Nripat(i) Nrip Abibek Mantrikeeyo|| Jih Dev Daeet Gaddhrab Mounndjeet Adand Dandah Leeyo||166||
translation: He destroyed Ravana and Jambhasura and killed Mahishasura, Madhu and Kaitabh;
